reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: If you are looking for a central hotel, you would do a lot worse than book the Ateneo. We stayed for two nights in late February and the hotel was excellent. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The rooms whilst not the biggest were fine and very clean. But what wins it for this hotel is the location, it a about a 2 minute walk to Puerta Del Sol square and metro. If you are prepared to walk for around 5 mins the bars are numerous and there is something for everyone, there are tapas and irish bars dotted up all the streets leading of the square. All in all if you are on a bit of a budget I recommend this hotel highly.

reviews.title: Good value hotel in a "hot" street
reviews.text: We have stayed several times in the Ateneo . Its a totally renovated hotel in an old building 1 block away from Puerta del Sol with all the attractives of Madrid (theaters , museums , shops , nightlife ) accesible by foot . Rooms are modern ,simple and quite big (specially those in the top floor ) , with huge bathrooms . Buffet-Breakfast are excellent and the staff is correct . Problems? The location is unbeatablely central but ... Calle Montera is the equivalent of Rue St.Denis in Paris , with girls staying in the street every 5 meters . This not represent a security problem at all but can be a little bit disturbing , even if this street activity is really not noisy .

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location, great breakfast lounge
reviews.text: The best Hotel we have had stayed before, because its location, staff, level of cleaning in their rooms and turistic areas to be visited, practically speaking you do not spend money on cabs or public transportaion, because is so centered and so strategycally well located that you really save money

The hotel staff makes you feel at home, is so great and even greater is the all you can eat breakfast included with the room price, so, having this feeling in your first visit to spain is so good, they tell you everything, where the best tapas restaurants are located at (By The Way Picoteo's, is the best and the cheapest one, We were 2 adults, one 10 year old child, eating any kind of tapas only spend 20 euros in total including drinks (cañitas)), where buying cheap and good souvenirs, even they tell you where not to go after certain hours in terms of your personal security.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having made a hasty retreat from a previously booked hotel, we found the neighboring Ateneo Hotel a most welcome relief. With underground secure parking nearby, we were free to wander the streets of Madrid (too often under construction) to a great variety of places of all types to eat, the museums to the east and the palaces to the west. And insofar as shopping, everything was right outside the door...the city's major department store, excellent art dealers and the required tacky T-Shirt vendors.

reviews.text: An excellent stay in late October 2006. The hotel is centrally located 2 minutes walk from Sol or Gran Via underground stations, and central for all Madrids attractions. Friendly efficient staff with smooth booking, check in and departure procedures. They all spoke excellent English. A very good and extensive breakfast with hot and cold dishes for everyone. Overall a very good experience at a reasonable price (110 e for room with breafast for 2 included).
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay
Perfect location, modern rooms, friendly & helpful staff
reviews.text: Although we had a second floor room with a balcony onto the busy main street below which is being pedestrianised and is subject to heavy road works, the noise was quiet as can be expected in any city centre. The street is a mixture of retail and leisure and seems to be a hang out for street hookers at all times of day. This does not detract from the area and it is by no means a sleazy or dodgy location. Theres a good mixture of locals, shoppers, punters and tourists all milling about together.

The hotel is very nice with great comfortable and refurbished rooms and en-suite bathrooms. The staff in the reception is very nice and the location is great in the very centre and good for tourism. The only less nice thing about the hotel is the breakfast, buffet but with little selection and runs out very fast, also the staff in the breakfast area (just one lady) was less and helpful. Good value for money in the busy and historical centre of Madrid.
reviews.title: Confortable and great location

reviews.text: This hotel was a great value in the heart of Puerta del Sol. Very clean and even has a computer in the lobby that allows you free internet access. Friendly staff. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel start of March. Modern, quiet and well designed rooms; friendly staff; and good breakfasts. What more could you ask for? Well, turn left out of the hotel and in 60 seconds you're in one of the main squares in the city! This also avoids most of the 'colourful' street inhabitants. Rooms and hotel look exactly as advertised on the Internet. All in all, will definitely stay here if I come back to Madrid

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great position, 100m. from the Puerta del Sol and its transport links, and the same distance from the Gran Via which is one of the main streets. To get to the latter, however ,you pass through the area referred to by everybody who has stayed here. It is actually quite a sight to see so many prostitutes in such a small area, in the middle of the day, and in the heart of a city.
